title: Casual Restaurant without Dedicated Bar Manager
system_mod: Use more concise operational language. Prioritize prep strategies over storytelling.
venue_context: Casual mid-sized restaurant with a neighborhood following. Beer and wine program is established, but the cocktail menu is basic and underperforming. No full-time bar manager — the bar is overseen by the GM, who also handles floor operations.
prompt: We don’t have a bar manager and our staff mostly serves or pours wine. But I still want a cocktail list that makes money and isn’t embarrassing. Where do we even start?
